comments.text:
Created attachment 523886
Screen capture demonstrating buggy behavior

1. Open a XUL document that contains any tree that has multiple columns and allows them to be moved.  (I'll use the "Your Certificates" tree in the Certificate Manager for these STR).
2. Drag to the first column position any of the columns which aren't by default already occupying the first position.  (In the Certificate Manager, after showing the "Issued On" column, I drag it to be before the "Certificate Name" column.)
3. From the colpicker, hide that newly-placed column (the "Issued On" column).
4. Hover the mouse over the starting edge of the first-by-default column (the "Certificate Name" column).

Actual results:
I get a resize cursor.  Furthermore, if you click on that spot, the splitter element receives the event.

Expected results:
The splitter effectively goes away when the not-first-by-default column ("Issued On") is hidden, and I get a default cursor when hovering over that spot.
